intro: Psammochloa villosa, commonly known as the silky sandgrass, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its fine, silky hairs that cover its leaves and stems. This perennial plant thrives in sandy soils and is well adapted to harsh, dry environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically green or pale yellow, and it plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils. Psammochloa villosa is often found in dunes and coastal areas, contributing to the ecological balance of its habitat.
